Can I use the `verus` command to list transactions in a specific range, but without specifying the `*` character?

The `verus listtransactions` command does require the `*` character to list transactions in a specific range. The correct syntax is `verus listtransactions "*" 20 100` to list transactions 100 to 120.

Examples:

List the most recent 10 transactions in the systems
> verus listtransactions

List transactions 100 to 120
> verus listtransactions "*" 20 100

As a json rpc call
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "listtransactions", "params": ["*", 20, 100] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
